JobTitle: Electrical Engineer II - RF Antenna Systems
JobFullDesc: Job Description :Exciting opportunity in Raytheon Intelligence and Space (RIS) electrical engineer based in Dallas, Texas with potential to have significant impact, recognition, and growth in the organization.  The engineer will have responsibility for the design, development, and deployment of Radio Frequency (RF) passive circuits (radiators, RF manifolds, RF transitions, etc.) and electromagnetic (EM) modeling.  The engineer will reside within the Hardware Engineering Center (HWEC) Antenna Products (AP) department headquartered in Dallas, Texas.  The HWEC AP department is responsible for full-scope Independent Design, Verification & Validation (IV&V) solutions for antenna products, including architecture trades, design, development, integration, deployment, and sustainment of antenna systems and associated integrated system verification solutions.  The engineer will implement best practice standards with regard to the planning, coordination, and execution of RF passive circuit design and EM modeling with sound engineering process discipline and leadership.  The successful candidate will have a solid foundation and experience in antenna engineering with specific knowledge in antenna radiators, RF manifolds, EM modeling techniques and associated best practice tools and processes. Required Skills: • Experience in passive circuit design and EM modeling• Solid understanding of antenna engineering principles including phased array theory.• Demonstrated ability to perform structured design processes, root-cause problem solving, and successful on-time / on-schedule task execution• Willing to participate in advancing the state of the art with regard to radiator design and EM design and modeling through continual innovation.• Working knowledge of test equipment including Antenna Ranges, Vector Network Analyzers, Spectrum Analyzers, Power Meters, etc.• Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)Desired Skills: •  Experience with Ansys HFSS, Keysight ADS, Matlab, and AutoCAD.• Excellent verbal and written communication skillsRequired Education:Bachelor’s degree in engineering, science, mathematics or related technical degreeBS and 2 years of experience, MS and 0 years of experienceDesired Education:  Master’s degree in engineering, science, mathematics or related technical degreeThe ability to obtain and maintain a US security clearance.  U.S. citizenship is required as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearanceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.
